meanings.sent1: Her preconception about spiders being scary made her scream when she saw one.
meanings.sent2: His preconception that all politicians are corrupt influenced his voting decisions.
meanings.sent3: Despite his preconception about spicy food, he ended up loving the hot curry.
meanings.sent4: The preconception that success equals happiness can lead to disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The preconception that dogs are always friendly was shattered when he encountered a growling one.

meanings.definition: An opinion formed beforehand without adequate evidence.
meanings.sent1: She held a preconception that the new restaurant would be terrible without even trying it.
meanings.sent2: His preconception that all teenagers are lazy was proven wrong when he met hardworking students.
meanings.sent3: The preconception that all cats hate water was challenged when she saw a cat swimming.
meanings.sent4: The preconception that success comes easily can hinder one's efforts to achieve their goals.
meanings.sent5: Breaking the preconception that all snakes are dangerous requires education and understanding.
